comments:
I created a simple HelloWorld test class in a newly created project. Then I 
created a Scrapbook page in that project, and entered the following code:

net.ihse.test.HelloWorld foo = new net.ihse.test.HelloWorld();

using code assist. All this worked very well. Then i entered the following 
fragment: 

foo.ma

I pressed ctrl-space, and selected the main method. At that point, I got an 
error message that didn't make sense (sorry, didn't write it down) and a log 
file was generated.

I have not been able to reproduce the bug, sorry.

This is the log file:

I could reproduce the problem now by closing down the scrapbook. This time I 
copied down the error message. It is: 

An internal error has occured. Failed to execute runnable 
(org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionaFailedException: assertion failed; ). 
See error log for more details.

Seems like the platform crashed under us. We might want to protect ourselves against those.

However, the error message is suspicious:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Property store is not
available for: /.


Please investigate

Moving to JUI. The used API #getSourceAttachmentPath is spec'ed to throw this 
exception in case of failure (caused by platform here).
*** Bug 6398 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Looking at the stack trace, the debugger is not involved. The 
JavaElementImageProvider catches the exception and logs an internal error. I do 
not believe there is anything else that we can do.

It looks like the platform was somehow corrupt, and the exception was handled - 
i.e. logged.

Erich, do you agree?

we have a separate PR for the restart problem after a crash with the same 
walkback. OK to close this one.

traces.message: Property store is not  available for: /.
Property store is not  available for: /.
